tag_list: media, ux, ipad, tablet, journalism, design, data
overview: Adriano Farano is co-founder at Watchup, a startup that is redesigning the mobile video experience with an iPad app that lets you catch up with news while you lean back and relax. Adriano is an EiR at StartX, the Stanford student startup accelerator in Palo Alto, California and he’s been serving as digital media strategist for OWNI, Inc. in San Francisco, CA. Adriano was a ‘11 Knight fellow at Stanford, where he’s been working on ways to augment the news experience on tablets. He previously served as VP, Business Development at OWNI, awarded twice the best non-English news site award by the Online News Association. Previously to OWNI, Adriano co-founded and ran cafebabel.com, a pan-European online media outlet entirely translated in 6 languages with offices in 35 European cities. Adriano created his first (and last) newspaper at age nine.

degrees.degree_type: John S. Knight fellowship for journalists

milestones.description: Awarded a Knight Fellowship at Stanford University
milestones.source_description: 2010-11 Knight Journalism Fellows Named at Stanford

milestones.description: The iPad video app Watchup is launched in the AppStore (source: Mashable)
